typedef void* MeshError
 

An opaque object containing information about errors generated in a TSTT method call.

This will be NULL for successful calls; non-null if an error is generated. Methods for checking the error status are provided.

Definition at line 196 of file TSTT_Base.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum EntityType
 

TSTT supports zero-, one-, two-, and three-dimensional entities associated with a mesh infrastructure, we allow users to access these dimensional entities using the enumerated type EntityType which contains.

Parameters:
VERTEX  a zero-dimensional entity (value=0)
EDGE  a one-dimensional entity (value=1)
FACE  a two-dimensional entity (value=2)
REGION  a three-dimensional entity (value=3)
NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES  the number of entities (value=4)
Enumeration values:
VERTEX 
EDGE 
FACE 
REGION 
NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES 

Definition at line 19 of file TSTT_Base.h. 

00020   {
00021     VERTEX=            0,
00022     EDGE=              1,
00023     FACE=              2,
00024     REGION=            3,
00025     NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES=  4
00026    };

enum EntityTopology
 

An enumeration of topological TSTT entities.

Note that not all TSTT meshes need to support all of these element types, but they do need to be able to answer questions such as: how many elements of each type do you have? and return the appropriate type for entity handles

So far we agreed to enumerate the following types - more could be defined as time progresses.

Parameters:
POINT  a general zero-dimensional entity (value=5)
LINE  a general one-dimensional entity (value=6)
POLYGON  a general two-dimensional element (value=7)
TRIANGLE  a three-sided, two-dimensional element (value=8)
QUADRILATERAL  a four-sided, two-dimensional element (value=9)
POLYHEDRAL  a general three-dimensional element (value=10)
TETRAHDRON  a four-sided, three-dimensional element whose faces are triangles (value=11)
HEXAHEDRON  a six-sided, three-dimensional element whose faces are quadrilaterals (value=12)
PRISM  a five-sided, three-dimensional element which has three quadrilateral faces and two triangular faces (value=13)
PYRAMID  a five-sided, three-dimensional element which has one quadrilateral face and four triangular faces (value=14)
SEPTAHEDRON  a seven-sided, three-dimensional element which has one hexagonal face and six triangular faces (value=15)
UNDEFINED  the value that is returned when the entity topology is unknown
Enumeration values:
POINT 
LINE 
POLYGON 
TRIANGLE 
QUADRILATERAL 
POLYHEDRON 
TETRAHEDRON 
HEXAHEDRON 
PRISM 
PYRAMID 
SEPTAHEDRON 
UNDEFINED

00064     PYRAMID=           14, 
00065     SEPTAHEDRON=       15,
00066     UNDEFINED=         16
00067   };

enum StorageOrder
 

An enumerated type giving the storage order for arrays of data (such as coordinate information).

Parameters:
BLOCKED  for storage orders such as xxxx...yyyy....zzzz(value=0)
INTERLEAVED  for storage orders such as xyzxyzxyzxyz... (value=1)
UNDETERMINED  returned if the storage order cannot be determined (value=2)
Enumeration values:
BLOCKED 
INTERLEAVED 
UNDETERMINED

Function Documentation

void Mesh_Create (  Mesh_Handle *    mesh,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Create a TSTT mesh.

This method must be called before any other TSTT methods.

Parameters:
mesh  (out) the pointer to the TSTT mesh interface to be created. No information will be loaded until Mesh_Load is called.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Load (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    name,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Load information into a TSTT mesh.

This method must be called after Mesh_Create and before any other methods can be called to access mesh or entity information. Note that multiple Mesh_Load calls can be made for a given Mesh_Handle. It is assumed that the union of information from each load call will be available in Mesh_Handle in the other TSTT methods.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is to be loaded.
name  (in) a string identifier for which mesh to load, for example from a file.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Services_GetInt (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    key,
Int *    value,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

A services method for getting integer information based on a string key value.

String values that are currently supported include "number of 0D entities" or "number of vertices" "number of 1D entities" or "number of edges" "number of 2D entities" or "number of faces" "number of 3D entities" or "number of regions"

It is anticipated that this function can be easily expanded to include other required key value pairs.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Services_GetFloat (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    key,
Float *    value,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

A services method for getting float information based on a string key value.

No string key values for this function are supported at this time.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

const char *    key,

A services method for getting double information based on a string key value.

No string key values for this function are supported at this time.

key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

A services method for getting string information based on a string key value.

No string key values for this function are supported at this time.

key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value

void Mesh_GetGeometricDimension (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
int *    dim,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Gets the geometric dimension of the mesh.

Note that this does not necessarily equal the highest topological entity as surface meshes consisting of two-dimensional topological elements can live in three space.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
dim  (out) the integer dimension of the mesh
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntities (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
Int *    num_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Gets an array of entity handles representing all of the entities of type entity_type.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entity_type  (in) one of the enumerated types given TSTT_VERTEX, TSTT_EDGE, TSTT_FACE, TSTT_REGION
entity_handles  (out) the array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (inout) the number of entities in the array If num_entities=0 on input, the mesh allocates the entity_handles array. If num_entities>=actual on input, it is expected that the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it. If num_entities<actual, an error is returned.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityAdjacency (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_requestor,
const EntityType    adjacency_entity_requested,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
Int **    csr_pointer,
Int **    csr_data,
Int *    num_adj_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the adjacenty list for the entities of the TSTT Mesh.

The entities are returned in the form of an array of EntityHandles which uniquely identify each mesh entity of a given type. We return the data in compressed sparse row (CSR) format. In this format three arrays are returned: csr_index: an integer array giving the location in the index array beginning each entity's adjacency list. For example, the starting point of the adjacencies for entity k (as given in csr_adjacencies array) is given by csr_index[k], and the number of adjacencies is given by csr_index[k+1]-csr_index[k]. csr_adjacencies: an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array entity_handles: the array containing unique identifiers for the requested adjacent entities

For example to request the vertex adjacency information of two triangles and a quadrilateral (the two triangles share vertices 1 and 2, the quadrilateral shares vertices 2 and three whith the second triangle) The csr_index array is 0, 3, 6, 10 The csr_adjacencies array is 0 1 2 1 2 3 2 3 4 5 The entity_handles array contains 6 elements uniquely identifying the vertices of the elements

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entity_requestor  (in) the type of entity making the adjacency request; one of VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, or REGION
adjacency_entity_requested  (in) the entity type requested; one of VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, or REGION
entity_handles  (out) the array of unique entity handles for the requested adjacencies
csr_pointer  (out) an integer array that gives the number of entities adjacent to each requestor. The TSTT mesh is required to allocate this array.
csr_data  (out) an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array. The TSTT mesh is required to allocate this array.
num_adj_entities  (inout) the number of entities in the array If num_adj_entities=0 on input, the mesh allocates the entity_handles array. If num_adj_entities>=actual on input, it is expected that the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it. If num_adj_entities<actual, an error is returned.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.
The following rules apply for what is returned from this function.

Downward adjacencies are clear.

Equal adjacencies are not well defined and return an error. We will eventually define neighbor relationships that will fill this gap.

Upward adjacencies are clear for conformal meshes, non conformal meshes are not defined at this time.

In particular, for the following entity_requestor:adjacency_entity_requested pairs we have

REGION:VERTEX returns the corner vertices of an region

REGION:EDGE returns the edges defining the region

REGION:FACE returns the faces defining the region

FACE:VERTEX returns the corner vertices of the face

FACE:EDGE returns the edges defining the face

EDGE:VERTEX returns the endpoints of the edge

VERTEX:REGION returns the regions for which it is a corner vertex

VERTEX:FACE returns the faces for which it is a corner vertex

VERTEX:EDGE returns the edges for which it is an endpoint

EDGE:REGION returns the regions which it helps define in that its endpoints are corner vertices of the returned regions

EDGE:FACE returns the faces which it helps define in that its endpoints are the corner vertices of the returned faces

FACE:REGION returns the elements which it helps define in that its corner vertices are the corner vertices of the returned elements

void Mesh_GetNativeStorageOrder (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
StorageOrder *    storage_order,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Gets the preferred storage ordering for the TSTT mesh component.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
storage_order  (out) the preferred storage order for the TSTT mesh component. If no storage order is preferred UNDETERMINED is returned.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetCoordinates (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const Int    num_entities,
Double *    coordinates,
StorageOrder *    storage_order,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the coordinates of the vertices.

Return an array of vertex coordinates that will be indexed with a global or local ID. The user may choose the storage order to be either interleaved, xyzxyzxyz storage or blocked, xxxyyyzzz storage. It is assumed that the coordinates are returned in a fixed order that will be reproduced if no mesh modifications have occurred between calls.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
num_entities  (in/out) the number of entities for which the user is requesting coordinate information. If this argument is zero on input, the TSTT mesh component will allocate the coordinate array and fill it. If this argument is not zero, it is assumed that the array coordinates is of sufficient length to store the requested coordinate information. If the array is not big enough an error is issued.
coordinates  (input/output): If this array is allocated on input then the results will be copied to this array if it is big enough, otherwise an error is issued. If this array has not been allocated space on input then the space will be allocated by this routine.
storage_order  (input/output): If this is set to BLOCKED or INTERLEAVED on input, the TSTT mesh is required to return the coordinates using that storage order. If this argument is set to UNDETERMINED, the TSTT mesh is free to choose one method or the other and set the value of storage_order to be the chosen type.
options  (input) : string containing options separated by semi-colons, options="option1; option2; ..." option = "local" : return the vertices local to this processor option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc. Example: options="interleaved; range(0:1000)" will return vertices 0 to 1000 in the interleaved format.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityIndicies (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entityType,
Int *    count,
Int *    index,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Return the indicies of the vertices that define all entities of a given type.

The index values (i.e. the global or local ID of a vertex) for entity i are given by (assuming a compressed-row format) : index[e1],...,index[e2-1] where e1=count[i], e2=count[i+1]

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entityType  (in) one of the enumerated types VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, REGION. This is the entity which is requesting the vertex adjacency information
count  (input): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
index  (input) : array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
options  (input) : a list of options, separated by semi-colons options="option1; option2; ...". option = "csr" : return in compressed-row format option = "expanded" : return in uncompressed format option = "HEXAHEDRON" : return only those regions that are also hexahedra. option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityAdjacencyIndicies (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entityType,
const EntityType    entityAdjacencyType,
Int *    count,
Int *    index,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Return adjacency information.

Example: To return the list of faces that are adjacent to all regions one would set entityType=REGION, entityAdjacencyType=FACE.

The index values for the adjacency i (numbered according to the order they are returned in the call to getEntitiesIndicies) are given by (assumming a compressed-row format) index[e1],...,index[e2-1] where e1=count[i], e2=count[i+1]

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entityType  (in): the requesting entity type, one of VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, or REGION
entityAdjacencyType  (in): the requested entity type adjacency, one of VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, or REGION. See the documentation for Mesh_GetEntityAdjacency for the rules describing the adjacency behavior.
count  (inout): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
index  (out): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
options  (in) : a list of options, separated by semi-colons, options="option1; option2; ...". option = "csr" : return in compressed-row format option = "expanded" : return in uncompressed format option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_InitializeWorksetIterator (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_type,
const Int    requested_workset_size,
Entity_Workset_Iterator *    workset_iterator,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Initialize the entity workset iterator.

The entities are returned in the Mesh_GetNextWorkset function defined below. Each iterator has an entity type and preferred workset size associated with it. Note that the Mesh_GetEntities function can be replaced with these two calls if desired.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which the iterator will be defined
entity_type  (in) one of the enumerated types given VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, REGION
workset_size  (in) the number of entities in each workset. The entities are returned in chunks of this size until the last workset for which the actual size will be less than requested size. Note that this can be set to a default of -1 to get the entire list of entities of a particular type.
workset_iterator  (out) the workset iterator. This structure should keep enough state information that the function Mesh_GetNextWorkset will be efficient. Note, it is assumed that workset_iterator keeps a pointer to its parent mesh object so that once it's created it cannot be used with multiple meshes.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetNextWorkset (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
Entity_Workset_Iterator    workset_iterator,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
Int *    num_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Iterator to get the next workset.

Workset_size entities are returned in the entity handle array until the final workset. This allows us to traverse the entities in manageable chunks and can be tuned to provide a balance between memory overhead and performance of accessing information through interfaces.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which the iterator is defined
workset_iterator  (in) the workset iterator. This structure should keep enough state information that entity access provided by this function is efficient. Note, it is assumed that workset_iterator keeps a pointer to its parent mesh object so that a mesh object does not need to be passed in to this function.
entity_handles  (out) the array of opaque entity handles in the workset
num_entities  (out) the number of entities in the workset array. num_entities will usually equal workset_size until the last workset is reached in which case it will be less than or equal to worksetsize. If the last workset contains a full worksetsize number of entities, an additional call to this function will return 0 entities.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_FreeEntityHandles (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
Entity_Handle *    entity_handles,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Frees the information in the entity_handles array.

Note that this does not delete the entities themselves, merely the opaque pointers to them.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) the array to free.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_FreeEntityAdjacency (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
Entity_Handle *    entity_handles,
Int *    csr_pointer,
Int *    csr_data,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Frees the information in the entity_adjacencies arrays.

Note that this does not delete the adjacent entities, merely the index arrays and opaque pointers associated with them.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) the array of opaque entity handles to free.
csr_pointer  (in) an integer array giving the number of entities adjacent to each requestor to free.
csr_data  (in) an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array to free.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Destroy (  Mesh_Handle    mesh,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Destroys the mesh information that is referenced by the opaque mesh handle mesh.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntitiesFromID (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Int *    ID,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

OPTIONAL FUNCTION that returns an array of opaque entity handles from an array of unique global IDs.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the mesh from which the entity will come
entity_type  (in) the entity type for which the request is being made
ID  (in) an array of integer ids that are unique within a given entity type
entity_handles  (out) an array of the corresponding opaque entity handles, it is assumed that the TSTT mesh allocates this array
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetGlobalID (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
Int    num_entities,
Int **    ID,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

OPTIONAL FUNCTION that returns an array of Identifiers for the input opaque entity_handles.

The Identifier is unique among entites of the same dimension (should this be among all entities?).

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
ID  (out) an array containing the integer IDs; it is assumed that the underlying component will allocate the space for the array
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetTopologicalDimension (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
const Int    num_entities,
Int *    dim,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Returns an integer array of topological dimensions for an input array of opaque Entity_Handles.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handle  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
dim  (out) an array containing the integer topological dimensions of the entities; it is assumed that the array has been allocated by the application to be of size num_entities.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetTopology (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
const Int    num_entities,
EntityTopology *    topology,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the topologies of an array of entities.

The value is returned as a value from the enumerated type EntityTopolgy.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
topology  (out) an array containing the topology of the entity; it is assumed that the array has been allocated by the application to be of size num_entities.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetType (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
const Int    num_entities,
EntityType *    type,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the type of an array of entities.

The value is returned as a value from the enumerated type EntityType. Note that duplicates the functionality in Entity_GetTopologicalDimension, but allows the user to work directly with the enumerated type rather than an integer.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
type  (out) an array containing the entity types; one of VERTEX, EDGE, FACE or REGION. It is assumed that the array is allocated by the application
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetVertexCoords (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
Int    num_entities,
StorageOrder    storage_order,
Double **    coords,
Int *    num_coords,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the coordinates of an array of vertex mesh entities.

The storage order options are handled as an enumerated type because it will be faster and more typesafe to check than a string option

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
storage_order  (in) the desired order of storage, blocked or interleaved
coords  (inout) a double array of size num_entities*num_dimension containing the vertex coordinates
num_coords  (inout) an integer giving the number of doubles in the array If num_coords=0, the mesh allocates the array If num_coords>=dimension*num_entites, the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it If num_coords<dimension*num_entites requested, an error is returned
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetAdjacencies (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
cEntity_Handle *    entity_handles,
Int    num_entities,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Entity_Handle **    adj_entities_handle,
Int **    csr_pointer,
Int **    csr_data,
Int *    num_adjacent,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Returns the number of adjacent entities of a given dimension and an array of unique identifiers for the adjacent entities.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh
entity_handles  (in) an array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (in) the number of entities in the array
entity_type  (in) the type of desired adjacencies
adj_entities_handle  (out) the array of opaque pointers containing the adjacent entity information
csr_pointer  (out) an integer array that gives the number of entities adjacent to each requestor; it is assumed that the array is allocated by the TSTT mesh
csr_data  (out) an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array; it is assumed that the array is allocated by the TSTT mesh
num_adjacent  (out) the number of adjacent entities If num_adjacent=0, the mesh allocates the adj_entities_handle array If num_adjacent>=actual, the application is assumed to have passed in an array for adj_entities_handle of that size, and the mesh fills it If num_adjacent<actual, an error is returned
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.
